lx4p

Class LXDMXInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • lx4p.LXDMXInterface
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LXDMXEthernet, LXENTTEC

    public abstract class LXDMXInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    LXDMXInterface Abstract class representing an interface capable of reading and writing dmx contained in a serial or network packet.
    Author:
    Claude Heintz

        Returns:

      • setNumberOfSlots

        public abstract void setNumberOfSlots(int slots)

        Parameters:
        slots - number of slots (aka addresses or channels)

      • getUniverse

        public abstract int getUniverse()
        DMX universe for send/receive

        Each dmx stream of up to 512 slots/addresses/channels is called a universe
        universe numbers vary by protocol

        The first universe in zero for Art-Net and one for sACN

        Returns:
        the dmx universe

      • setUniverse

        public abstract void setUniverse(int u)
        set DMX universe for send/receive

        Each dmx stream of up to 512 slots/addresses/channels is called a universe
        universe numbers vary by protocol

        The first universe in zero for Art-Net and one for sACN

        Parameters:
        u - the dmx universe

      • readPacket

        public abstract boolean readPacket()
        attempt to read a protocol packet
        Returns:
        true if packet contained dmx output

        attempt to send a dmx packet

      • byte2int

        public static int byte2int(byte b)
        conversion utility byte->int

        Java seems to do a straight cast to int from byte as if the byte is signed

        Parameters:
        b - byte to convert
        Returns:
        int value of unsigned byte
